comments.body: Do you want to commit this info? Should we add to gitignore once it is an example file?

So I wanted to put real(ish) data here as an example.  Also, I thought the .gitignore trick worked, but it doesn't...

Another option would be to make this file be .gitignore and make a openstack_config.yml.example. And the end user would have to cp the .example to just .yml and then make edits....

I'd still probably leave this data for reference though...

OK just wondering. looks real alight :smile:. that password...

As for the file I haven't played with this so if vagrant tried to pick up this config by default the end-user might not understand why. I would say having a `.example` file extension would make it very clear. Then just call out the copy  in the README.

I do use crappy passwords, but THAT one isn't one of my crappy passwords   :)

I'll move to the .example version and make the .yml in .gitignore.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +-1,3 @@os_username: eparis
os_password: redhat
os_tenant: "RH US Business Group"
